Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.at_scale_memory_margining.at_scale_memory_margining

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase

import os
import re
import json
import six

src_one_path = "/mnt/vol/havoc/autotest/bin/561970_Intel_MMA_for_Purley_Rev15/"
src_two_path = "/mnt/vol/havoc/autotest/bin/startup.nsh"
dst_path = "/boot/efi/"



[docs]class AtScaleMemMarginCheck(TestBase):


[docs]    def __init__(self, dir_mma=src_one_path, file_mma=src_two_path,
                 dst_files=dst_path):
        super(AtScaleMemMarginCheck, self).__init__()
        self.bios_settings = self.test_control['bios_settings']
        self.margin_guidelins = self.test_control['margin_guidelins']
        self.is_bios_setting_modified = 0
        self.are_files_copied_successfully = 0
        self.is_mma_test_executed_successfully = 0
        self.is_sanity_check_successfully = 0
        self.is_rx_tx_above_gudeline = 0
        self.is_cmd_ctl_above_gudeline = 0
        self.dir_mma = dir_mma.encode('utf-8')
        self.file_mma = file_mma.encode('utf-8')
        self.dst_files = dst_files.encode('utf-8')
        self.original_bios_path = os.path.join(
            self.resultsdir,
            "original_bios_dump.txt"
        )



[docs]    def setup(self):
        super(AtScaleMemMarginCheck, self).setup(inband_config_check=False)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("At Scale Memory Bus Signal Margining Test")

        self.log_info("Taking original BIOS dump backup")
        self.original_bios_path = self.host.bios.get_bios_settings_dump(
            self.original_bios_path
        )
        # This will update bios_settings, execute MMA test,
        # and parse result data against Pass/Fail criteria
        self.log_info("Updating the bios with changes")
        # This will update bios_settings if any settings modified
        temp_bios_dump = os.path.join(self.resultsdir, "temp_bios_dump.txt")
        self.bios_changes = self.host.bios.update_bios_settings(
            self.bios_settings,
            temp_bios_dump
        )
        self.copy_mma_files()
        self.is_mma_test_executed_successfully = self.execute_mma_test()
        self.validate_condition(self.is_mma_test_executed_successfully,
                                "MMA test exectuion completed")
        self.is_sanity_check_successfully = self.data_parse_sanity_check()
        self.validate_condition(self.is_sanity_check_successfully,
                                "Sanity check completed. Margin is between 0 and 255")
        self.margin_rx_tx_dict()
        self.margin_cmd_ctl_dict()
        self.is_rx_tx_above_gudeline = self.margin_guideline_rx_tx_validate()
        self.validate_condition(self.is_rx_tx_above_gudeline,
                                "All RX and TX parameters meet Intel guidelines."
                                "You\'ve passed the memory bus signal margining test!")
        self.is_cmd_ctl_above_gudeline = self.margin_guideline_cmd_ctl_validate()
        self.validate_condition(self.is_rx_tx_above_gudeline,
                                "All CMD and CTL parameters meet Intel guidelines."
                                "You\'ve passed the memory bus signal margining test!")


    # Copy mma files to /boot/efi

[docs]    def copy_mma_files(self):
        cmd = "cp -r %s %s" % (self.dir_mma, self.dst_files)
        self.host.run(cmd)
        cmd = "cp %s %s" % (self.file_mma, self.dst_files)
        self.host.run(cmd)


    # Set boot priority to EFI shell, reboot, and execute MMA test

[docs]    def execute_mma_test(self):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/efibootmgr-remount -n 0001"
        out = self.host.run(cmd)
        self.validate_condition(out, "Efibootmgr set to EFI shell")
        self.log_info("Executing MMA test......")
        self.self.host.inband.reboot()
        return True


    # Check result file exists and do a sanity check of data

[docs]    def data_parse_sanity_check(self):
        test_dir = "/boot/efi/561970_Intel_MMA_for_Purley_Rev15/results"
        cmd = "cp RMT_01.tsv %s" % self.resultsdir
        self.host.run(cmd, working_directory=test_dir)
        boot_dir = "/boot/efi"
        cmd = "rm -rf 561970_Intel_MMA_for_Purley_Rev15"
        self.host.run(cmd, working_directory=boot_dir)
        cmd = "sudo chmod 777 RMT_01.tsv"
        self.host.run(cmd, working_directory=self.resultsdir)
        out = self.host.oob.get_manufacturer()

    # Check if it is Quanta or Wiwynn platform. Restore BIOS default settings.
        if out == "Quanta":
            cmd = "ipmitool raw 0x30 0x52 0x83 0x01 0x02 0x03 0x00 0x04"
            self.host.run(cmd)
        if out == "Wiwynn":
            cmd = "ipmitool raw 0x30 0x52 0x83"
            self.host.run(cmd)

        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/efibootmgr-remount -n 0004"
        out = self.host.run(cmd)
        os.chdir(self.resultsdir)

        lines = open('RMT_01.tsv').readlines()
        open('RMT_DATA.txt', 'w').writelines(lines[27:])
        lines = open('RMT_DATA.txt').readlines()
        for line in lines:
            x = re.split(r'\t+', line)
            header = json.loads(x[0].replace("'", '"'))
            margin = json.loads(x[1])
            for low, high in margin:
                r = range(0, 256)
                if low not in r:
                    print("{} :Margin {} is not between 0 and 255". format(header,
                          low))
                elif high not in r:
                    print("{} :Margin {} is not between 0 and 255". format(header,
                          high))
                else:
                    return True

    """
    # Orangize result file based on Result Type 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 ,5
    # 0: Per-rank Rx and Tx timing/Vref
    # 1: Per-rank Cmd and Ctl timing/Vref
    # 2: Per-lane Rx and Tx timing/Vref
    # 3: Per-rank Rx and Tx timing/Vref, Turnarounds stress
    # 4: Rx and Tx timing/Vref, margin range
    # 5: Cmd and Ctl timing/Vref, margin range

    """

[docs]    def encode_dict(self, d, codec='utf8'):
        ks = d.keys()
        for k in ks:
            val = d.pop(k)
            if isinstance(val, six.string_types):
                val = val.encode(codec)
            elif isinstance(val, dict):
                val = self.encode_dict(val, codec)
            if isinstance(k, six.string_types):
                k = k.encode(codec)
            d[k] = val
        return d



[docs]    def margin_rx_tx_dict(self):
        lines = open('RMT_DATA.txt').readlines()
        l_no = 0
        for line in lines:
            l_no += 1
            x = re.split(r'\t+', line)
            header = json.loads(x[0].replace("'", '"'))
            header_encode = self.encode_dict(header)
            margin = json.loads(x[1])
            mma_result = []
            json_mma_result = {}
            if header_encode['bits']['ResultType'] in [0, 2, 3, 4]:
                mma_margin = dict([('RxDqs-', margin[0][0]),
                                  ('RxDqs+', margin[0][1]), ('RxV-', margin[1][0]),
                                  ('RxV+', margin[1][1]), ('TxDqs-', margin[2][0]),
                                  ('TxDqs+', margin[2][1]), ('TxV-', margin[3][0]),
                                  ('TxV+', margin[3][1])])
                mma_margin_encode = self.encode_dict(mma_margin)
                for k, v in mma_margin_encode.items():
                    header_encode['bits'][k] = v
                json_mma_result["mma_result{}".format(l_no)] = json.dumps(header_encode)
                mma_result.append(header_encode)
                self.result_handler.add_test_results(json_mma_result)
                with open('mma_rx_tx_margin.txt', 'a') as fp:
                    for item in mma_result:
                        fp.write("%s\n" % item)



[docs]    def margin_cmd_ctl_dict(self):
        lines = open('RMT_DATA.txt').readlines()
        l_no = 0
        for line in lines:
            l_no += 1
            x = re.split(r'\t+', line)
            header = json.loads(x[0].replace("'", '"'))
            header_encode = self.encode_dict(header)
            margin = json.loads(x[1])
            mma_result = []
            json_mma_result = {}
            if header_encode['bits']['ResultType'] in [1, 5]:
                mma_margin = dict([('Cmd-', margin[0][0]),
                                  ('Cmd+', margin[0][1]), ('CmdV-', margin[1][0]),
                                  ('CmdV+', margin[1][1]), ('Ctl-', margin[2][0]),
                                  ('Ctl+', margin[2][1])])
                mma_margin_encode = self.encode_dict(mma_margin)
                for o, p in mma_margin_encode.items():
                    header_encode['bits'][o] = p
                mma_result.append(header_encode)
                json_mma_result["mma_result{}".format(l_no)] = json.dumps(header_encode)
                self.result_handler.add_test_results(json_mma_result)
                with open('mma_cmd_ctl_margin.txt', 'a') as fp:
                    for item in mma_result:
                        fp.write("%s\n" % item)


    # Validate MMA parameters

[docs]    def mma_parameter_validate(self, message, message_one,
                               file_lines, parameter_key, parameter_value):
        parameters = {}
        for line in file_lines:
            margin = json.loads(line.replace("'", '"'))
            key = parameter_key
            parameters.setdefault(key, []).append(margin['bits'][parameter_key])
        for k, v in parameters.items():
            self.validate_greater(min(v), parameter_value,
                                  message.format(file_lines[v.index(min(v))]),
                                  message_one.format(k, min(v),
                                  parameter_value))


    # Validate Rx/Tx results against Intel Guidelines

[docs]    def margin_guideline_rx_tx_validate(self):
        lines = open('mma_rx_tx_margin.txt').readlines()
        msg = "Evaulating {} Validating parameter"
        msg_1 = "{} minimum value {} is above Intel guideline {}"

        key = "RxDqs-"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['RxDqs_low'])
        key = "RxDqs+"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['RxDqs_high'])
        key = "TxDqs-"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['TxDqs_low'])
        key = "TxDqs+"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['TxDqs_high'])
        key = "RxV-"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['RxV_low'])
        key = "RxV+"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['RxV_high'])
        key = "TxV-"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['TxV_low'])
        key = "TxV+"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['TxV_high'])

        return True



[docs]    def margin_guideline_cmd_ctl_validate(self):
        lines = open('mma_cmd_ctl_margin.txt').readlines()
        msg = "Evaulating {} Validating parameter"
        msg_1 = "{} minimum value {} is above Intel guideline {}"

        key = "Cmd-"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['Cmd_low'])
        key = "Cmd+"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['Cmd_high'])
        key = "CmdV-"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['CmdV_low'])
        key = "CmdV+"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['CmdV_high'])
        key = "Ctl-"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['Ctl_low'])
        key = "Ctl+"
        self.mma_parameter_validate(msg, msg_1, lines, key,
                                    self.margin_guidelins['Ctl_high'])

        return True



[docs]    def cleanup(self):
        custom_filter = []
        if self.is_mma_test_executed_successfully:
            self.log_info("MMA execution completed.So,skipping BMC config chk")
            custom_filter.append('log_util')
        if self.bios_changes:
            self.log_info("Reverting back the original BIOS settings")
            self.host.bios.update_bios_setting_from_dump(self.original_bios_path)
        super(AtScaleMemMarginCheck, self).cleanup(
            cfg_filter=custom_filter,
            inband_config_check=False
        )




[docs]def main():
    test = AtScaleMemMarginCheck()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
